title: 1891–92 British Home Championship
text:
The 1891–92 <a href="British%20Home%20Championship">British Home Championship</a> was an edition of the annual international <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> tournament played between the British <a href="Home%20Nations">Home Nations</a>. It was won by <a href="England%20national%20football%20team">England</a> who won all three games against their rivals, even though they played two games on the same day against <a href="Wales%20national%20football%20team">Wales</a> and <a href="Ireland%20national%20football%20team%20%281882%E2%80%931950%29">Ireland</a>, providing a team of amateur players for the Welsh match and professionals against Ireland, both teams forging solid 2–0 victories. <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> came second, winning their matches against Wales and Ireland, who shared third place after drawing with one another.
England's double victories came shortly after the Welsh-Irish draw in <a href="Bangor%2C%20Gwynedd">Bangor</a> and it gave them an immediate advantage over their opponents. The Scottish team then played their games, narrowly beating Ireland in <a href="Belfast">Belfast</a> and defeating Wales by a crushing 6–1 scoreline to equal England's points tally and become favourites. In the final match at <a href="Glasgow">Glasgow</a>, England and Scotland played out a decider which England won easily, scoring four early goals to which Scotland could only reply with a single goal of their own.
